column4: i just installed ubuntu and it looked fine, after booting it show the loading screen with the 4 dots but then it show a grey screen and nothing is happening
nvidia 420
should i have skipped the install 3rd party software?
good idea, that way you will use "nouveau" intead of the priopretary driver, but with nouveau you can not play 3D games like Urban Terror =(
you can see the logins screen?
i can see the loading screen, i tried hitting escape then some text flashed on the screen then it "loaded" the gfx driver and went "black"
i never get to the login screen
could be the bugy version of the nvidia 295.40 (already confirmed by Nvidia)
so im at the recovery mode, what should i do then?
aptitude search nvidia-current
sudo apt-get install aptitude
that failed, w: not using locking for read only lock file blablabal
what command gives you that outputs?
paste:  lsmod | grep nvidia
it says 12319264     0
do not say "nvidia" anywhere?
nope
paste:  lsmod | grep nouveau
maybe the service "NetworkManager" is not runing on the rescue mode: sudo service network-manager start   may do the job
i forget, if you just uninstall the nvidia driver with: sudo apt-get remove nvidia-current   then you will automatically boot with nouveau =P
Yeah!!
see what is the version driver
